alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Monroe; Morgan; Owen; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monroe, western Morgan, southwestern Hendricks, northeastern Owen and southeastern Putnam Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Greencastle, or 28 miles northwest of Bloomington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Monroe, western Morgan, southwestern Hendricks, northeastern Owen and southeastern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... Lake Hart, Gosport, Quincy, Little Point, Monrovia, Eminence, Paragon, Cloverdale, Cagles Mill Lake and Devore. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 36 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and west central Indiana.
